Note that my point above was,

Can quantum computers replace classical ones?
and not, "Can quantum computation replace classical computation?"
With my idea being, if quantum computers can decently perform classical computation, is there any need for classical computers in the future?

Thats the short term future！
My entire point is what comes beyond that？

And if Quantum computers can perform classical computation, with little overhead, which means, if QPUs can perform the tasks of CPU as well, with the same efficiency or QPUs can simulate CPUs via software
and
The complexity and cost of manufacturing a powerful Quantum computer comes close to the manufacturing cost of an equally powerful Classical Computer

Are Classical Computers really needed in the future, even for classical computation？
